item.title: inZOI: Everything New You Can Do In The Island Getaway DLC
item.description:
Island Getaway is the first DLC for inZOI , and as it's free, all players can enjoy themselves on the islands of Cahaya. While many features carry over from the other two cities of Dowon and Bliss Bay, there are plenty of new and exclusive things to do in Cahaya.

Naturally, many of the new features in Island Getaway include the beach and sea of the holiday location, but there are also ways for long-term residents of the islands to make a living, such as farming and crafting.

Players need to claim the free DLC and download it. Simply updating the game is not enough.

Farming, Mining, & Crafting

A New Way To Play inZOI

If players choose to live on the main island, then they can try to make a living and do a rags-to-riches playthrough by living off the land. It's possible to farm and sell food products at a local shop, with players eventually being able to take over this shop. Bad floods, however, might mess up the crops, so planning for disasters is key.

Mining is another possibility, which ties into crafting and other similar mechanics that players might expect to find in Stardew Valley and other similar games. Players will want to build a crafting table in their yard, with something like a pickaxe being a good early option.

Stay At A Resort

Experience A Luxury Holiday In inZOI

While Zois can live on the main island and make a living for themselves, there is also the option to visit the resort island and book a stay for a couple of nights. There are a few different villas to choose from, but be prepared to have enough money, not only for the accommodation, but for extras too. Some villas even have swimming pools, but this accommodation cannot be modified in build mode.

At the resort, there are activities such as billiards and bowling, as well as an arcade area where zois exchange money for Resort Coins. They can then test their luck at various arcade games, and even challenge other players to basketball shots, with Resort Coins being given to the winner of the bet.

Snorkeling/Diving

Swim With Fish & Explore Coral Reefs Or Submerged Temples

One of the main attractions of Cahaya is underwater diving, but first, zois must purchase snorkeling gear. A zoi must also improve their swimming skill before they are able to dive. Exercises in the water, such as practicing holding their breath, can also help level up this skill.

With a high enough swimming skill, zois can then either swim out to deeper waters or rent a boat and climb off its back. Underwater, players will be able to swim with fish, and in different parts of the sea marked on the map, they will find turtles, dolphins, and even dangerous marine life such as sharks and jellyfish. There are also coral reefs to explore, and ancient temples submerged on the sea floor. Here, they may even find treasure.

Drive Boats & Fish From Them

Get The Most Out Of The Islands Of Cahaya

Six different types of boats can be rented in Cahaya, allowing families of zois to enjoy the open waters. This works similarly to driving cars, but is more of a leisure activity. If players require transportation to any of the three islands, there are instant boat taxis, similar to other public transport in inZOI , essentially fast travel.

Players can use their boat to kick off diving adventures, to explore the coasts freely, or they can even fish from the back of one as long as they've bought, found, or crafted a fishing rod. There is even the option to sunbathe on some boats.

New Careers Including Tourism & Conservation

Unfortunately, They Are All Rabbit Hole Jobs

There are a variety of new jobs unique to Cahaya, while a few, such as working as a lawyer, carry over. At the release of the Island Getaway DLC , the following are all the available careers, all of which are full-time

  • Junior Lawyer
  • Rookie Criminal
  • Tour Guide Trainee
  • Nestwatcher for Turtles
  • Investigator for an Encyclopedia Association
  • Rookie Taxi Driver
  • Lotus Space Assistant for Meditation & Yoga
  • Farmer
  • Miner

Some of these have room for promotions, but there are no promotions for miners or gardeners. Unfortunately, these are all rabbit hole jobs for now, so players won't actually get to experience the work themselves.

Spa Day

Zois Can Relax In The Sauna Or Receive Massages

At Cahaya's resort, there is everything one could need for fun and relaxation, including a spa, which must be paid for. If a zoi is stressed and overworked, a spa day is the perfect solution, and they will find a sauna, as well as massage options.

In the massage chairs, zois can receive separate massages for their feet, hands, and scalp, or they can have their feet soaked in buckets of fish or roses. On the massage tables, they can instead receive full-body massages provided by the staff.

Visit The Cat Temple

Play With Cats, Give Them Treats, & Meditate With Them

While this DLC doesn't allow players to have pets, with that feature promised for the future, players can get their animal fix by visiting the Cat Temple in Cahaya. Outside, players can purchase various cat-related items, such as treats, toys, a talisman, and Catnip Candy.

Then they can climb the temple stairs and interact with the cats, giving them treats or playing with them. Depending on the zoi's personality and needs, this will likely make them happy. There is even the option to meditate with the cats. The temple is technically called the Miatara Temple and is found in the southern part of the resort island.

7 Images
7 Images

item.title: Final Fantasy 14 Reveals The Rising 12th Anniversary Event
item.description:
Final Fantasy 14 is gearing up to celebrate its 12th anniversary with The Rising event, featuring a brand-new questline and the Wind-up Gulool Ja Ja as a free reward. From August 27 until September 11, all Final Fantasy 14 fans can participate in this event and earn this charming reward.

The Rising is the name given to the in-game event that celebrates the re-release of Final Fantasy 14: A Realm Reborn in 2013, and in-universe, the Calamity that nearly wiped out Eorzea at the end of the original MMO. The rewards from The Rising are some of the most exciting and popular of all holiday events, such as the Phoenix transformation mount from the critically-acclaimed MMORPG’s 10th anniversary in 2023.

The Rising Returns to Final Fantasy 14 on August 27, 2025

Now, The Rising is returning in 2025 with another fantastic reward. Starting August 27 at 12 AM PT, and running until September 11 at 7:59 AM PT, players will be able to pick up the “An Adventurous Ambition” quest from the Wandering Minstrel in Limsa Lominsa. Characters only need to be level 15 in order to participate, meaning even new fans should have no trouble doing so. Completing this quest will reward them with the Wind-up Gulool Ja Ja minion, allowing them to bring a tiny version of the beloved Dawntrail character to join the Warrior of Light on their travels.

Historically, The Rising has a tendency to break the fourth wall, often using the Wandering Minstrel – FF14 director and producer Naoki “Yoshi-P” Yoshida’s in-game proxy – to deliver a message of thanks directly to the playerbase. Additionally, these events often contain cryptic clues for future story developments. Considering FF14 just wrapped up the main story arcs of Dawntrail in Patch 7.3, fans may receive a subtle teaser for the next expansion during the quest.

In the meantime, the Moonfire Faire event is still ongoing, with the summer celebration concluding on August 26, right before The Rising starts. Then, in early October, Monster Hunter Wilds is crossing over with FF14 , featuring an obtainable Seikret mount and a special encounter against Guardian Arkveld.

Were this not exciting enough, Final Fantasy 14 might be coming to the Switch 2 soon. Yoshida has reportedly had “positive discussions” with Nintendo about bringing FF14 to the platform, which would expand the popular MMO to a whole new community. If Switch 2 gamers are lucky, they may also be able to participate in future runs of The Rising event within the next year or two.

item.title: Day One Xbox Game Pass FPS Title Confirmed for Early 2026
item.description:
High On Life 2 will launch on February 13, 2026, Squanch Games has confirmed. The irreverent sci-fi shooter's predecessor was a major hit on Xbox Game Pass, so it came as no surprise that the sequel would also come to Microsoft's gaming subscription service. Now fans have gotten a closer look at High On Life 2 , including a firm release date.

Squanch Games announced that High On Life was getting a sequel in June 2025 during the Xbox Games Showcase. That reveal also confirmed that High On Life 2 , like the first game, would be a day-one Xbox Game Pass title, set to come out sometime in the coming winter. The initial trailer also revealed plenty of new action and talking guns players could look forward to, and now Squanch Games has offered some more insight into what to expect from the game.

High on Life 2 is Coming to Xbox Game Pass and Other Systems on February 13, 2026

During Gamescom 2025, Squanch Games revealed that High On Life 2 will arrive on Xbox Game Pass, as well as PC and PS5, in February of next year. The announcement comes not long after the first High On Life returned to Xbox Game Pass in July after leaving the platform in June 2024, so subscribers have a chance to relive the original before diving into the sequel early next year. Alongside the release date, the Gamescom preview revealed a few other details about High On Life 2 , including the introduction of Ralph Ineson, who gamers may know from The Witch or The Fantastic Four: First Steps , to the cast of talking guns.

As the initial trailer showcased, players will get the chance to move around on a skateboard instead of the standard sprint option. Actors Betsy Sodaro, J.B. Smoove, and Richard Kind will be returning to voice the same weapons they did in the first title, and by the looks of the Gamescom demo, High On Life 2 takes its predecessor's combat and platforming to new heights. The game is seemingly sticking close to the spirit of the original, which makes sense, considering how High On Life was the biggest day-one Xbox Game Pass release of 2022 when it came out.

High On Life 2 wasn't the only big news for Xbox Game Pass users of Gamescom 2025. During the Opening Night Live pre-show, developer Lunar Software confirmed that its upcoming horror game ROUTINE will launch in Q4 2025 as a day-one Game Pass title. Gamers will have to wait for a specific release date, but it's looking like a good time to be an Xbox fan.

item.title: Games That Are Having The BIGGEST 2025
item.description:
Summary

  • Plenty of great games have dominated 2025 so far, from live-service and AAA blockbusters to small indie hits.
  • Despite releasing in 2024, Marvel Rivals and Delta Force remain live-service successes with large player bases and ongoing updates.
  • R.E.P.O. , PEAK , and Schedule 1 all emerged as surprise indie hits, gaining popularity with high player numbers and positive reviews.

While still far from over, 2025 has already turned out to be full of great games and strong GOTY contenders. From long-anticipated AAA blockbusters to sudden indie hits, from enduring live-service titles to single-player-only releases — any player can find something worthwhile to play this year, no matter the platform or taste.

Today, we are examining some of the biggest games of 2025 so far that have truly made an impact, outshining even the huge blockbusters like Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 , Assassin's Creed: Shadows , and Death Stranding 2: On The Beach . This isn't a best-seller list, as numerous factors are considered here, including sales, peak player counts, reviews, discussions, and the overall excitement surrounding each title. Here are some of the games that have defined 2025 so far.

The games below are sorted by release date, from older to newer.

Delta Force

An Unexpected Competitor for Call of Duty and Battlefield

6 Images
6 Images
Delta Force
8.2 /10
Released
December 5, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by

Wait, what is Delta Force doing here, wasn't it originally released in 2024? Sure it was, yet throughout 2025, Delta Force (formerly Delta Force: Hawk Ops ) has significantly strengthened its position on PC, just recently crossing the impressive milestone of 200,000 concurrent players on Steam. At the same time, it finally debuted on other major platforms with crossplay support — just in time to give CoD and BF fans something to chew on while waiting for the next big entries.

While the game's current position is definitely favorable, it remains to be seen whether Delta Force will stay afloat this fall, once Black Ops 7 and Battlefield 6 are launched. Still, the game's free-to-play nature might help with that, and 2025 may continue to bring strong results for the tactical shooter with its variety of game modes.

Marvel Rivals

The Recent Live-Service Heavy-Hitter

Marvel Rivals
9 /10
106
8.8 /10
Released
December 6, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen // Violence
Powered by

In a case almost similar to Delta Force , Marvel Rivals was released in December 2024, but the game's enduring popularity has guaranteed that it consistently remains among the most-played titles of 2025 across various platforms, supported by an enormous player base and a constant stream of updates adding new characters.

Marvel Rivals peaked this January, amassing 644,000 concurrent players on Steam, but unlike many other popular games, it has proved it's here to stay. After several not-so-great attempts, Marvel games are finally becoming a real force in the modern gaming landscape, with Marvel Snap and Marvel Rivals already smash hits, and plenty of anticipated upcoming titles like Marvel Tōkon: Fighting Souls , Marvel 1943: Rise of Hydra , Marvel's Wolverine , and Marvel's Blade in the pipeline. Move up, MCU.

R.E.P.O.

The First Among Indie Dominators Of 2025

R.E.P.O.
20
8.7 /10
Released
February 26, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by

R.E.P.O. ( Retrieve, Extract and Profit Operation ) was the first huge PC indie hit of 2025, appearing seemingly out of nowhere and making some real numbers despite being an early access game. With 96% positive reviews from players and an impressive all-time peak of 271,000 concurrent players on the platform, R.E.P.O. unexpectedly entered the top 50 of Steam's most-played titles ever.

This online cooperative survival horror game is quite similar to fan-favorite Lethal Company , providing thrills and sheer fun driven by players themselves. Coupled with an affordable price and strong word of mouth, it's exciting to see what's next for R.E.P.O. in 2025 and beyond.

Monster Hunter Wilds

When Hype Outweighs The Result

Monster Hunter Wilds
58
8.2 /10
Released
February 28, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen // Violence, Blood, Crude Humor
Powered by

Monster Hunter Wilds is by far the most controversial game among these, constantly surrounded by debates and negativity due to its technical state, lack of endgame content, and other issues that prevent it from reaching the glory of its predecessor, Monster Hunter World . Nevertheless, the game is easily among the best-selling (over 10 million copies sold) and most-played new titles of the year so far, which is impossible to ignore.

While Monster Hunter Wilds' all-time player count peaked at an astounding 1.4 million, sales significantly slowed after the first month due to poor word of mouth (currently sitting at just 50% positive on Steam). It will be interesting to see whether Capcom can turn the tide in the years to come, though the announced crossovers may help bring in new players.

Schedule 1

Simplicity & Fun Make For An Overwhelming Success

Schedule I
Simulation
Crime
Action
Management
Strategy
Systems
Developer(s)
TVGS

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by

Another one (but not the last!) of the unexpected indie hits, the co-op crime simulator Schedule 1 was among the most-played new titles for almost three months straight, despite launching in early access. The figures are truly impressive: Schedule 1 boasts a 98% positive rating and secured a spot among the top 30 most-played games on Steam, with about 459,000 simultaneous players this March.

Simplicity and fun are clearly among the winning trends for several of 2025's most-played and popular games, proving that colossal budgets and photorealistic graphics aren't essential to making players happy.

Clair Obscur: Expedition 33

RPG Of The Year, No Less

Clair Obscur: Expedition 33
146
9.4 /10
Released
April 24, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
Mature 17+ // Blood and Gore, Strong Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Powered by

Who hasn't heard of Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 this year? This debut RPG from a small team looked too good to be true, yet somehow managed to overdeliver, instantly joining the pantheon of the most beloved RPGs of recent years. Despite launching on Game Pass, Expedition 33 still amassed impressive numbers, peaking at almost 150,000 players on Steam and selling over 3 million copies across all platforms.

From art and music to story and its innovative combat system, Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 is a triumph and a prime contender for GOTY 2025. Winning the hearts of everyone who has experienced this gem, the game was one of the most shared and discussed on social media in a long time.

Elden Ring Nightreign

Most Experimental For The Studio Yet

Elden Ring Nightreign
9 /10
19
8.8 /10
Released
May 30, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by

One of the most experimental titles by FromSoftware in quite a long time, Elden Ring Nightreign proved divisive for the studio's fanbase, and it's easy to see why. Nightreign deliberately sets aside much of what players have come to expect from single-player soulslikes, instead offering a fast-paced, roguelike boss-rush experience alongside other players.

Despite initial concerns, it's now safe to say that Elden Ring Nightreign has found its audience, peaking at 313,000 players and holding an 83% positive rating on Steam. Of course, it's a far cry from the original Elden Ring 's success back in 2022, yet given the game's positioning, it's a bold attempt by FromSoft to try something new that ultimately bears fruit and strengthens the Elden Rin g brand.

Mario Kart World

Welcoming The New Platform Owners

Mario Kart World
34
7.0 /10
Released
June 5, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
Everyone // Mild Fantasy Violence, Users Interact
Powered by

No list of the biggest games is complete without a Nintendo title, and this year Mario Kart World takes the crown (sorry, Donkey Kong Bananza ). As a launch title for the Switch 2 console, Mario Kart World was bound to become one of the most-discussed games of the year, selling over 5 million copies in its first month.

While generating overall positive buzz for its open-world design, Mario Kart World was also somewhat criticized for its lack of content, especially considering the hefty $80 price tag. Regardless of one's stance on whether that's justified, Mario Kart World is undeniably one of the definitive titles of the year.

PEAK

Joining The Elite Club Of Indie Smash Hits

PEAK
9.3 /10
Released
June 16, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by

One of the newest unexpected hits alongside R.E.P.O. and Schedule 1 , PEAK 's story is even more fascinating, as the game has only continued to grow in popularity more than two months after its already successful launch. Just this weekend, thanks to its first discount, PEAK reached over 170,000 players, and it was also reported that the game had already sold over 10 million copies — so who knows what's next for this small but endlessly fun co-op game?

With 93% positive reviews and weeks of ongoing praise online, more and more players are giving the game a try with their friends — and so far, very few have left disappointed.

Battlefield 6

A Teaser Of What's To Come

Battlefield 6
FPS
War & Military
Action
Systems
Released
October 10, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by

Battlefield 6 is one of the rare games that managed to make a notable splash even before its launch, currently slated for this October. With several overwhelmingly successful betas under its belt that drew millions of players across all platforms, Battlefield 6 has already surpassed Call of Duty 's all-time player count on Steam — just a hint of a potentially colossal and much-needed hit for EA.

While everything is still ahead for Battlefield 6 , it's safe to assume that the game's launch will be equally huge. Luckily, players won't have to wait long to experience everything the release version has to offer.

item.title: PlayStation 5 Consoles Are Getting More Expensive in the US
item.description:
Sony has announced imminent price hikes for PlayStation 5 consoles in the US. These price increases target both the physical and digital versions of the base PS5, as well as the stronger PS5 Pro.

The PS5 was launched in late 2020 for an asking price of $500 for the standard version and $400 for the discless Digital Edition. Where consoles historically dropped in price over their lifecycles, though, this trend has yet to rear its head for the PS5. In fact, the PS5 saw price increases in numerous regions over the past few years, including a $50 increase for the Slim Digital Edition that launched in late 2023. Sony did explain last year that the PS5 price stagnation is due to its chipset's die size being "very difficult" to reduce, and that remains the case to date.

PS5 Prices Will Increase By $50 in the US from Tomorrow

Now, the PS5 is set to become even more expensive to bring home, as Sony confirmed in a recent PlayStation Blog post that the console's pricing will be hiked by $50 across the board starting tomorrow, August 21 . This means that the PS5 Digital Edition will jump from $449 to $499, the standard PS5 will go from $499 to $549, and the already-controversial $699 PS5 Pro will cost $749. Sony says that this PS5 price increase was made in light of "a challenging economic environment," and notably, prices for the console's accessories will not see any change in the US, at least for now.

PS5 Price Increase Details

  • Goes into effect tomorrow, August 21
  • Blanket $50 increase for all PS5 versions
  • PS5 Digital Edition: $499
  • PS5: $549
  • PS5 Pro: $749

This hike comes not long after Sony CFO Lin Tao stated during the company's Q4 FY2025 earnings call that global inflation and tariff tensions between the US and China - where the majority of PS5 units are manufactured - could lead to widespread price increases for the console. Just a month prior to Tao's statement, Sony increased PS5 prices in major regions like the UK, Europe, Australia, New Zealand, and more, similarly citing a "challenging economic environment," as well as "high inflation" and "fluctuating exchange rates." The US is currently the strongest market for PlayStation, and it's evident that Sony was holding off on increasing prices in the region for as long as possible.

Of course, Sony isn't the only console maker that has succumbed to price hikes in recent memory. Back in May, Microsoft announced sweeping price increases for Xbox consoles, accessories, and even upcoming games ($80). Interestingly, the PS5 will be $50 less expensive than the Series X - which currently costs $600 - but the fact that these consoles were the most affordable when they launched is nothing short of uncanny.
